page.title: 09Green Street Mosque, Bristol
page.content: Every day I go to the mosque in Bristol, except on Sundays. There are always over 50 children there. The mosque session ends at 5.30 p.m. for girls. In the mosque, we read the Koran and some girls, including myself, learn to read and write Urdu. Many people in my school respect the mosque. When you go into the mosque, you must not show your legs and you have to wear a dupata on your head. Boys wear a hat on their heads, but for smaller children, it is not necessary to wear anything on their heads. Before reading the Koran, you must do your wazu which is a special wash. Many English people come to visit the mosque, especially on special occasions such as Eid, Pakistan Day etc. Also people come to take photographs for their projects.
